original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānuloma (1), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽3.5. Saññojanagocchaka, Kusalattika🔽3.5.1.1. Kusalākusalapada🔽Hetu🔽Nosaññojanaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nosaññojano kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽Saññojanaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojano akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Saññojanaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nosaññojano akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava …pe… nakamme tīṇi …pe… navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta  na hetuyā tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava pe na kamme tīṇi pe na vippayutte nava
translated: As non-cause, three. As non-decisive support, nine. As non-action, three. As non-kamma, three. As non-nutritive-essence, nine. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi …pe… sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāro api pe sampayutta vāro api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā
translated: (The section on origination in dependence on conascence, etc., is to be developed in the same way as the section on condition.)

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Saññojano akusalo dhammo saññojanassa akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… upanissaye āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, āhāre indriye jhāne tīṇi, magge sampayutte nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saññojanaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ saññojanassa akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe upanissaye āsevane nava kamme tīṇi āhāre indriye jhāne tīṇi magge sampayutte nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta  na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta  hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: An unwholesome idea originated by attachment is a condition, as cause condition, for an unwholesome idea originated by attachment. (In brief.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: As cause, three. As object, nine. As decisive support, nine. As support, nine. As prenascence, nine. As nutriment, nine. As faculty, nine. As jhāna, three. As path, nine. As association, nine. As dissociation, nine. As presence, nine. As absence, nine. As disappearance, nine. As non-disappearance, nine. As root, three. As non-root, nine. As non-cause, nine. As non-decisive support, nine. As non-restraint, nine. As non-rebirth-linking, nine. As non-path, nine. As non-review, nine. As non-direct-knowledge, nine. As non-guarding, nine. As non-initiation, nine. As non-culmination, nine. As non-detonation, nine. As non-arising, nine. As non-arisen, nine. As non-birth, nine. As non-originated, nine. As non-ageing, nine. As non-decay, nine. As non-desinence, nine. As non-disappearance, nine. As non-passing-away, nine. As non-change, nine. As non-stopping, nine. As non-discernment, nine. As non-conascence, nine. As non-contemporaneousness, nine. As non-depen dence, nine. As non-possession, nine. As non-non-possession, nine. As non-obtainment, nine. As non-non-obtainment, nine. As non-defeat, nine. As non-accomplishment, nine. As non-root, nine. As non-non-root, nine. As

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: (As in the case of the three wholesome roots, the questions in the section on the triplets should be calculated in the same way as in the section on the pairs, with direct, reverse, and both direct and reverse order.)

original: 3.5.1.2. Abyākatapada
analyzed: a byākata pada
translated: … Undetermined Factors

original: Hetu🔽Nosaññojanaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nosaññojano abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu  no saññojanam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca no saññojanaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: Root Cause🔽With root cause and not a fetter, an undetermined factor … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽3.5.2. Saññojaniyaduka, Kusalattika
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta  sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka  saññojaniya duka kusalattika
translated: With root cause, one … With object, one … With ignorance, one … (Abbreviated.)🔽(In the section on conascence, etc., and in the section on the questions, all the triplets are to be enumerated in the same way as the pairs.)

original: 3.5.2.1. Kusalākusalapada🔽Hetu
analyzed: kusala a kusala pada  hetu
translated: … To Be Directly Known by One of Wisdom, Wholesome Roots🔽… Wholesome and Unwholesome Factors🔽Root Cause

original: Saññojaniyaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojaniyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: saññojaniyam kusalam dhammam paṭicca saññojaniyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With root cause and subject to cankers, a wholesome factor …

original: Asaññojaniyaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asaññojaniyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: asaññojaniyam kusalam dhammam paṭicca asaññojaniyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With root cause and not subject to cankers, a wholesome factor … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve
translated: With root cause, two … With object, two … (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā cūḷantaraduke lokiyadukagamanaṁ, evaṁ imampi ñātabbaṁ. Sahajātavāropi …pe… pañhāvāropi vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: yathā cūḍantara duke lokiya duka gamane evam imam pi sahajāta vāropi pe pañhā vāropi vitthāretabbā
translated: (As in the case of the first tetrad, so here too the method of treatment should be understood as stated in the case of the first triad of the World of Sense Desire.)

original: Saññojaniyaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojaniyo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saññojaniyam akusalam dhammam paṭicca saññojaniyaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: From a wholesome state that gives rise to conceit there arises a wholesome state that gives rise to conceit, through the relation of cause. (In brief:)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: In the case of cause, there is one; in the case of object, one; … in the case of absence, one. (In brief:)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the case of the section on conascence, etc., and in the case of the questions, in each instance there is one.)

original: 3.5.2.2. Abyākatapada
analyzed: a byākata pada
translated: The Undetermined State

original: Hetu🔽Saññojaniyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojaniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Asaññojaniyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asaññojaniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetu  saññojaniyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca saññojaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  asaññojaniyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca asaññojaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Cause🔽From a state that gives rise to conceit that is undetermined there arises a state that gives rise to conceit that is undetermined, through the relation of cause.🔽From a state that does not give rise to conceit that is undetermined there arises a state that does not give rise to conceit that is undetermined, through the relation of cause.

original: Asaññojaniyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojaniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: asaññojaniyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca saññojaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: From a state that does not give rise to conceit that is undetermined there arises a state that gives rise to conceit that is undetermined, through the relation of cause.

original: Asaññojaniyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojaniyo abyākato ca asaññojaniyo abyākato🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Saññojaniyaṁ abyākatañca asaññojaniyaṁ abyākatañca dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojaniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: a saññojaniyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca saññojaniyaḥ abyākato ca a saññojaniyaḥ abyākato  ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  saññojaniyam abyākatañca asaññojaniyam abyākatañca dhammam paṭicca saññojaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an object that is leading to attachment and also not leading to attachment …🔽With a cause as condition, five …🔽With an object as condition, two …

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… avigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve adhipatiyā pañca pe avigate pañca
translated: With predominance as condition, five …

original: Cūḷantaraduke lokiyadukasadisaṁ. (Sahajātavāropi …pe… sampayuttavāropi vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāropi pe sampayutta vāropi vitthāretabbā
translated: In the small section on the internal sense bases, the method of explanation is similar to that in the section on the world. (The section on origination should be elaborated in the same way as the section on the faculties.)

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Saññojaniyo abyākato dhammo saññojaniyassa abyākatassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: saññojaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ saññojaniyassa abyākatassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An object that is leading to attachment and indeterminate is a condition, as cause condition, for an object that is leading to attachment and indeterminate.

original: Asaññojaniyo abyākato dhammo asaññojaniyassa abyākatassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: asaññojaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ asaññojaniyassa abyākatassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: An object that is not leading to attachment and indeterminate is a condition, as cause condition, for an object that is not leading to attachment and indeterminate. … (Abbreviated.)🔽With a cause as condition, four …🔽With an object as condition, three …🔽With predominance as condition, four …

original: Hetuyā cattāri, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā cattāri …pe… avigate satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā cattāri ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā cattāri pe avigate satta saṅkhitta
translated: With non-disappearance as condition, seven. (Abbreviated.)

original: Saññojaniyo abyākato dhammo saññojaniyassa abyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: saññojaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ saññojaniyassa abyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A condition by way of object condition is a condition by way of object condition for a conditionable neutral thought.🔽A condition by way of arising together condition is a condition by way of arising together condition for a conditionable neutral thought.

original: paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena
analyzed: paccayo sahajāta paccayena paccayo  upanissaya paccayena paccayo  purejāta paccayena
translated: A condition by way of support condition is a condition by way of support condition for a conditionable neutral thought.🔽A condition by way of prenascence condition is a condition by way of prenascence condition for a conditionable neutral thought.🔽A condition by way of postnascence condition is a condition by way of postnascence condition for a conditionable neutral thought.🔽A condition by way of nutriment condition is a condition by way of nutriment condition for a conditionable neutral thought.

original: paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … āhārapaccayena paccayo … indriyapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ indriya paccayena
translated: A condition by way of faculty condition is a condition by way of faculty condition for a conditionable neutral thought.

original: paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: (Condensed.)

original: Nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta saṅkhitta
translated: In the absence of cause there are seven. In the absence of object there are seven. (Condensed.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe cattāri. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe cattāri
translated: In the presence of cause there are four. In the absence of object there are four. (Condensed.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: In the absence of cause there are three. In the presence of object there are three. (Condensed.)🔽(Just as in the case of the three wholesome questions, the forward order, the reverse order, the forward and reverse order, and the reverse and forward order have been calculated, so should it be calculated here.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)🔽3.5.3. Saññojanasampayuttaduka, Kusalattika
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba  saññojana sampayutta duka kusala ttika
translated: ... The pair: associated with fetters, wholesome, etc.

original: 3.5.3.1. Kusalākusalapada
analyzed: kusala a kusala pada
translated: ... The triad: wholesome, unwholesome, etc.

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Saññojanavippayuttaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojanavippayutto kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saññojana vippayuttam kusalam dhammam paṭicca saññojana vippayuttaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With a wholesome object that is not connected to the defilements … (abbreviated).

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: With a wholesome cause … (abbreviated).

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽Saññojanasampayuttaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojanasampayutto akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka  saññojana sampayuttam akusalam dhammam paṭicca saññojana sampayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: (In the section on origination through conascence, etc., and in the question section, there is one result in each triad.)🔽An unwholesome state that is connected to the defilements is a condition, as a cause condition, for an unwholesome state that is connected to the defilements. … (The rest are abbreviated.)

original: Saññojanasampayuttaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojanasampayutto akusalo dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saññojana sampayuttam akusalam dhammam paṭicca saññojana sampayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: An unwholesome state that is connected to the defilements is a condition, as a object condition, for an unwholesome state that is connected to the defilements. … (The rest are abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe pañca, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ, anulomaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe pañca adhipatiyā ekam pe avigate pañca saṅkhitta anuloma
translated: With a cause … With an object … With predominance … (The rest are abbreviated.)

original: Paccanīya
analyzed: paccanīya
translated: Reverse order

original: Nahetu
analyzed: na hetu
translated: Not a cause

original: Saññojanasampayuttaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojanasampayutto akusalo dhammo
analyzed: saññojana sampayuttam akusalam dhammam paṭicca saññojana sampayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo
translated: An unwholesome state that is connected to the defilements is a condition, as a cause condition, for an unwholesome state that is connected to the defilements.

original: uppajjati nahetupaccayā—vicikicchāsahagate khandhe paṭicca vicikicchāsahagato moho.🔽Saññojanasampayuttaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojanavippayutto akusalo dhammo
analyzed: uppajjati na hetu paccayā vicikicchā sahagate khandhe paṭicca vicikicchā sahagataḥ moho  saññojana sampayuttam akusalam dhammam paṭicca saññojana vippayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo
translated: With non-cause as condition: with doubt and uncertainty, the associated ignorance.🔽An unwholesome state that is connected with the fetters has as its condition an unwholesome state that is unconnected with the fetters.

original: uppajjati nahetupaccayā—uddhaccasahagate khandhe paṭicca uddhaccasahagato moho. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: uppajjati na hetu paccayā uddhacca sahagate khandhe paṭicca uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: With non-cause as condition: with agitation and uncertainty, the associated ignorance. (In brief.)

original: Nahetuyā dve, naadhipatiyā pañca, napurejāte pañca …pe… nakamme tīṇi …pe… navippayutte pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ, paccanīyaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā dve na adhipatiyā pañca na purejāte pañca pe na kamme tīṇi pe na vippayutte pañca saṅkhitta paccanīya
translated: With non-cause as condition there are two; with non-decisive support as condition there are five; with non-pre-nascence there are five … With non-kamma as condition there are three … With non-deprivation as condition there are five. (In brief, in reverse order.)

original: Hetu🔽Saññojanasampayutto akusalo dhammo saññojanasampayuttassa akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: hetu  saññojana sampayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ saññojana sampayuttassa akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Cause🔽An unwholesome state that is connected with the fetters is a condition, as cause condition, for an unwholesome state that is connected with the fetters.

original: Saññojanavippayutto akusalo dhammo saññojanasampayuttassa akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: saññojana vippayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ saññojana sampayuttassa akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An unwholesome state that is unconnected with the fetters is a condition, as cause condition, for an unwholesome state that is connected with the fetters.

original: Saññojanasampayutto akusalo dhammo saññojanasampayuttassa akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … nava.
analyzed: saññojana sampayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ saññojana sampayuttassa akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nava
translated: An unwholesome state that is connected with fetters is related to an unwholesome state that is connected with fetters as object condition … nine.

original: Saññojanasampayutto akusalo dhammo saññojanasampayuttassa akusalassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saññojana sampayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ saññojana sampayuttassa akusalassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: An unwholesome state that is connected with fetters is related to an unwholesome state that is connected with fetters as prenascence condition … as proximity condition … as contiguity condition … as dependence condition … as non-disappearance condition.

original: Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā ekaṁ, anantare samanantare nava, sahajāte aññamaññe
analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā eka anantare samanantare nava sahajāte aññamaññe
translated: In the section on root cause, there are two. In the section on object, there are nine. In the section on predominance, there is one. In the sections on proximity and contiguity, there are nine. In the section on mutuality, there are nine.

original: nissaye pañca, upanissaye āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, āhāre indriye jhāne magge tīṇi,
analyzed: nissaye pañca upanissaye āsevane nava kamme tīṇi āhāre indriye jhāne magge tīṇi
translated: In the section on support, there are five. In the section on decisive support, there are nine. In the section on nutriment, there are three. In the sections on faculty, absorption, and path, there are three.

original: sampayutte pañca, atthiyā pañca …pe… avigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sampayutte pañca atthiyā pañca pe avigate pañca
translated: In the section on association, there are five. In the section on presence, there are five. … In the section on non-disappearance, there are five. (In brief.)

original: 3.5.3.2. Abyākatapada
analyzed: a byākata pada
translated: … The Undetermined Faculties

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Root Cause

original: Saññojanavippayuttaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojanavippayutto abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saññojana vippayuttam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca saññojana vippayuttaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: A state that is unconnected with fetters is related to an undetermined state that is unconnected with fetters as root cause condition. (In brief.)🔽In the section on root cause, there is one. In the section on object, there is one. … In the section on non-disappearance, there is one. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: As to cause: one … As to object: one … As to condition: one … As to root: one … As to faculty: one … As to jhāna: one … As to path: one … As to element: one … As to ignorance: one … As to one who is extinguished between two existences: one … As to an apparitionally born Brahmā: one … As to a Brahmā who is a great one: one … As to a Brahmā of a thousand: one … As to a Brahmā of two thousand: one … As to a Brahmā of three thousand: one … As to a Brahmā of four thousand: one … As to a Brahmā of five thousand: one … As to a Brahmā of six thousand: one … As to a Brahmā of seven thousand: one … As to a Brahmā of eight thousand: one … As to a Brahmā of nine thousand: one … As to a Brahmā of ten thousand: one … As to a Brahmā of a half asankheyyas: one … As to a Brahmā of a quarter asankheyyas: one … As to a Brahmā of a hundred asankheyyas: one … As to a Brahmā of a thousand asankheyyas: one … As to a Brahmā of a hundred thousand asankheyyas: one … As to a Brahmā of a hundred thousand times asankheyyas: one … As to a Brahmā of a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand asankheyyas: one … As to a Brahmā of a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand times asankheyyas: one … As to a Brahmā of a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand asankheyyas: one … As to a Brahmā of a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand asankheyyas: one … As to a Brahmā of a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand asankheyyas: one … As to a Brahmā of a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand asankheyyas: one … As to a Brahmā of a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand times

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽3.5.4. Saññojanasaññojaniyaduka, Kusalattika
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka  saññojana saññojaniya duka kusala ttika
translated: (In the section on origination, etc., too, each time the triplet is to be elaborated in the same way as the dyad.)🔽… with fetters and things that can be abandoned by means of the path,

original: 3.5.4.1. Kusalākusalapada
analyzed: kusala a kusala pada
translated: … with the wholesome triad,🔽… with the unwholesome dyad,

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Saññojaniyañceva no ca saññojanaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojaniyo ceva no ca saññojano kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saññojaniyam ca iva no ca saññojanam kusalam dhammam paṭicca saññojaniyaḥ ca iva no ca saññojanaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With a wholesome factor that is a thing that can be abandoned by means of the path but is not a fetter, a wholesome factor that is a thing that can be abandoned by means of the path but is not a fetter is related by way of root-cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta  sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: In the section on root-cause, there is one. In the section on object, there is one. … In the section on non-hindrance, there is one. (In brief.)🔽(In the section on origination, etc., too, each time the triplet is to be elaborated in the same way as the dyad.)

original: Saññojanañceva saññojaniyañca akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojano ceva saññojaniyo ca akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saññojanam ca iva saññojaniyam ca akusalam dhammam paṭicca saññojanaḥ ca iva saññojaniyaḥ ca akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an unwholesome factor that is a fetter and a thing that can be abandoned by means of the path, an unwholesome factor that is a fetter is related by way of root-cause condition. … There are three. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on root-cause, there are nine. In the section on object, there are nine. In the section on predominance, there are nine. … In the section on non-hindrance, there are nine. (In brief.)

original: Nahetuyā tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta
translated: With non-root-cause as condition, three … With non-predominance as condition, nine … With non-decisive-support as condition, nine … With non-kamma as condition, three … With non-result as condition, nine … With non-path as condition, nine … With non-non-causally-ly related as condition, nine. (In brief) …

original: (Sahajātavāropi …pe… sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāro api pe sampayutta vāro api paṭicca vāra sadisā
translated: (The section on origination should be elaborated in accordance with the method of the Dependent Origination.)

original: Saññojano ceva saññojaniyo ca akusalo dhammo saññojanassa ceva saññojaniyassa ca akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saññojanaḥ ca iva saññojaniyaḥ ca akusalaḥ dhammaḥ saññojanassa ca iva saññojaniyassa ca akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A factor that is a fetter and subject to the cankers is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a factor that is a fetter and subject to the cankers. (In brief) …

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… upanissaye āsevane nava, kamme āhāre indriye jhāne tīṇi, magge sampayutte nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe upanissaye āsevane nava kamme āhāre indriye jhāne tīṇi magge sampayutte nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: With root-cause as condition, nine … With object as condition, nine … With predominance as condition, nine … With decisive-support as condition, nine … With absence as condition, nine … With disappearance as condition, nine … With destruction as condition, nine … With change as condition, nine … With ageing as condition, nine … With subsistence as condition, nine … With non-disappearance as condition, nine … With non-destruction as condition, nine … With non-change as condition, nine … With non-ageing as condition, nine … With non-subsistence as condition, nine … With death as condition there is grief, despair, and suffering. (In brief) …

original: Nahetuyā nava naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: With non-root-cause as condition, nine … With non-object as condition, nine. (In brief) …

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: With root-cause condition, non-object, three …

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: With non-root-cause condition, object, nine. (In brief) …

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: (As in the case of the three profitable thoughts, the questions in the Mode of Conveying Questions are to be worked out in the Modes of Conveying a Fourfold Array, a Threepath Array, and a Twofold Array.)

original: 3.5.4.2. Abyākatapada🔽Saññojaniyañceva no ca saññojanaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojaniyo ceva no ca saññojano abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: a byākata pada  saññojaniyam ca iva no ca saññojanam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca saññojaniyaḥ ca iva no ca saññojanaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: (As in the case of the three wholesome roots, the questions in the section on the triplets beginning with “formed” should be calculated in direct and reverse order, as in the case of the section on the triplets beginning with “skillful.”)🔽… Undetermined🔽From an undetermined object that generates attachment and is not a fetter, an undetermined object that generates attachment and is not a fetter arises, related by root cause. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta  sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: In the root-cause condition there is one, in the object condition there is one … in the non-hindrance condition there is one. (In brief.)🔽(In the section on conascence, etc., and in the section on questions, there is one in each triad.)

original: 3.5.5. Saññojanasaññojanasampayuttaduka, Kusalattika
analyzed: saññojana saññojana sampayutta duka kusala ttika
translated: … The dyad of fetters and associated with fetters, the skillful triad

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Root cause

original: Saññojanañceva saññojanasampayuttañca akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojano ceva saññojanasampayutto ca akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: saññojanam ca iva saññojana sampayuttañca akusalam dhammam paṭicca saññojanaḥ ca iva saññojana sampayuttaḥ ca akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: From a skillful object that is a fetter and is associated with a fetter, an object that is a fetter and is associated with a fetter arises, related by root cause. … There are three.

original: Saññojanasampayuttañceva no ca saññojanaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojanasampayutto ceva no ca saññojano akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Saññojanañceva saññojanasampayuttaṁ akusalañca saññojanasampayuttañceva no ca saññojanaṁ🔽akusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojano ceva saññojanasampayutto ca akusalo dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: saññojana sampayuttañca iva no ca saññojanam akusalam dhammam paṭicca saññojana sampayuttaḥ ca iva no ca saññojanaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  saññojanam ca iva saññojana sampayuttam akusalam ca saññojana sampayuttam ca iva no ca saññojana  akusalañca dhammam paṭicca saññojanaḥ ca iva saññojana sampayuttaḥ ca akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati
translated: A non-hindrance that is related to a fetter has arisen … (three times).

original: hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: A non-hindrance that is related to a fetter has arisen … (three times).

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: (In brief:) Nine in the cause, nine in the object, nine in the predominance, etc. (in brief).

original: Nahetuyā tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavāropi … sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: na hetuyā tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta 🔽sahajāta vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā
translated: (In brief:) Three in the non-cause, nine in the non-predominance, nine in the non-arisen, nine in the post-arisen, nine in the non-kamma-result, nine in the non-associated, nine in the non-supported.

original: Saññojano ceva saññojanasampayutto ca akusalo dhammo saññojanassa ceva saññojanasampayuttassa ca akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saññojanaḥ ca iva saññojana sampayuttaḥ ca akusalaḥ dhammaḥ saññojanassa ca iva saññojana sampayuttassa ca akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: An unwholesome state that is a fetter and related to a fetter is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a fetter and for an unwholesome state related to a fetter. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… upanissaye āsevane nava, kamme āhāre indriye jhāne tīṇi, magge sampayutte nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe upanissaye āsevane nava kamme āhāre indriye jhāne tīṇi magge sampayutte nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on root-cause there are three. In the section on object there are nine. In the section on predominance there are nine. … In the section on decisive support and in the section on kamma there are nine. In the section on nutriment there are three. In the section on faculty there are three. In the section on jhana there are three. In the section on path there are nine. … In the section on non-deprivation there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava, naadhipatiyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava na adhipatiyā nava
translated: In the section on non-root-cause there are nine. In the section on non-object there are nine. In the section on non-predominance there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: In the section on root-cause condition, in the section on non-object there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta  yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: In the section on non-root-cause condition, in the section on object there are nine. (Abbreviated.)🔽… As in the case of the three wholesome kinds of consciousness, the method of exposition should be understood here in the same way as in the exposition of the questions in the section on the three kinds of consciousness that are wholesome.

original: 3.5.6. Saññojanavippayuttasaññojaniyaduka, Kusalattika
analyzed: kusala ttika
translated: … In the case of the triad that is dissociated from a fetter and is to be abandoned by a fetter, the wholesome triad,

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Root-cause

analyzed: saññojana vippayuttam saññojaniyam kusalam dhammam paṭicca saññojana vippayuttaḥ saññojaniyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā

original: Saññojanavippayuttaṁ saññojaniyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojanavippayutto saññojaniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Saññojanavippayuttaṁ asaññojaniyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojanavippayutto
analyzed: saññojana vippayuttam saññojaniyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca saññojana vippayuttaḥ saññojaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  saññojana vippayuttam asaññojaniyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca saññojana vippayuttaḥ
translated: With an object that is not connected to the fetters and is not subject to the fetters, a state that is not connected to the fetters and is not subject to the fetters arises, conditioned by root cause.

original: asaññojaniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Saññojanavippayuttaṁ asaññojaniyaṁ🔽abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojanavippayutto saññojaniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: asaññojaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saññojana vippayuttam asaññojaniya  abyākatam dhammam paṭicca saññojana vippayuttaḥ saññojaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati
translated: With an object that is not connected to the fetters and is not subject to the fetters, a state that is not connected to the fetters and is not subject to the fetters arises, conditioned by root cause.🔽With an object that is not connected to the fetters and is not subject to the fetters, a state that is connected to the fetters and is subject to the fetters arises, conditioned by root cause.🔽With an object that is not connected to the fetters and is not subject to the fetters, a state that is connected to the fetters and is subject to the fetters arises, conditioned by root cause.

original: hetupaccayā. Saññojanavippayuttaṁ asaññojaniyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojanavippayutto
analyzed: hetu paccayā saññojana vippayuttam asaññojaniyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca saññojana vippayuttaḥ
translated: With an object that is not connected to the fetters and is not subject to the fetters, a state that is connected to the fetters and is subject to the fetters arises, conditioned by root cause.

original: saññojaniyo abyākato ca saññojanavippayutto asaññojaniyo abyākato ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Saññojanavippayuttaṁ saññojaniyaṁ abyākatañca saññojanavippayuttaṁ asaññojaniyaṁ
analyzed: saññojaniyaḥ abyākataḥ ca saññojana vippayuttaḥ asaññojaniyaḥ abyākataḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā 🔽saññojana vippayuttam saññojaniyam abyākatam ca saññojana vippayuttam a saññojaniya
translated: With an object that is not connected to the fetters and is not subject to the fetters, a state that is connected to the fetters and is subject to the fetters arises, conditioned by root cause.🔽With an object that is not connected to the fetters and is not subject to the fetters, a state that is connected to the fetters and is subject to the fetters arises, conditioned by root cause.

original: abyākatañca dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojanavippayutto saññojaniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati🔽hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: abyākatañca dhammam paṭicca saññojana vippayuttaḥ saññojaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati  hetu paccayā
translated: With a unwholesome and an indeterminate …🔽With an unwholesome and a neutral …🔽With a unwholesome and a neutral …🔽With a wholesome and an unwholesome …🔽With a wholesome and an indeterminate …🔽With a unwholesome and an indeterminate …

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… āsevane ekaṁ, kamme pañca, vipāke pañca …pe… avigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve adhipatiyā pañca pe āsevane eka kamme pañca vipāke pañca pe avigate pañca saṅkhitta

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā dve, napurejāte cattāri, napacchājāte
analyzed: na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā dve na purejāte cattāri na pacchājāte

original: pañca, naāsevane pañca, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ, navippayutte dve …pe… novigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: pañca na āsevane pañca na kamme eka na vipāke eka na vippayutte dve pe no vigate tīṇi

original: (Sahajātavāropi …pe… sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāro api pe sampayutta vāro api paṭicca vāra sadisā
translated: With a unwholesome and an indeterminate …🔽With a unwholesome and a neutral …🔽With a unwholesome and a neutral …🔽With a wholesome and an unwholesome …🔽With a wholesome and an indeterminate …🔽With a unwholesome and an indeterminate …🔽With a unwholesome and a neutral …🔽With a unwholesome and a neutral …

original: Saññojanavippayutto saññojaniyo abyākato dhammo saññojanavippayuttassa saññojaniyassa abyākatassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saññojana vippayuttaḥ saññojaniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ saññojana vippayuttassa saññojaniyassa abyākatassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: With a wholesome and an unwholesome …🔽With

original: Hetuyā cattāri, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā cattāri, anantare cattāri …pe… sahajāte🔽pañca, aññamaññe dve, nissaye satta, upanissaye cattāri, purejāte pacchājāte dve,
analyzed: hetuyā cattāri ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā cattāri anantare cattāri pe sahajāte  pañca aññamaññe dve nissaye satta upanissaye cattāri purejāte pacchājāte dve
translated: There are four in terms of cause, three in terms of object, four in terms of predominance, four in terms of proximity, …🔽five in terms of presence, two in terms of mutuality, seven in terms of support, four in terms of decisive support, two in terms of prenascence and postnascence,🔽🔽

original: āsevane ekaṁ, kamme …pe… magge cattāri, sampayutte dve, vippayutte tīṇi …pe… avigate🔽satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: āsevane eka kamme pe magge cattāri sampayutte dve vippayutte tīṇi pe avigate  satta saṅkhitta
translated: As condition, four lines. As object, three lines. As predominance, four lines. As proximity, four lines. … As contiguity, four lines. … As decisive support, four lines. … As repetition, four lines. … As root cause, four lines. … As nutriment, four lines. … As faculty, four lines. … As jhāna, four lines. … As path, four lines. … As association, two lines. … As non-disappearance, seven lines. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta saṅkhitta
translated: As non-root cause, seven lines. As non-object, seven lines. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe cattāri. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe cattāri
translated: As condition being a root cause, as non-object, four lines. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: As condition being a non-root cause, as object, three lines. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: (As in the case of the three wholesome kinds of consciousness, the method of exposition should be understood as applied in the case of the questions in the remaining triplets and couplets, with the appropriate changes in each instance.)

original: Saññojanagocchakakusalattikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: saññojana gocchaka kusala ttikam niṭṭhita
translated: The exposition of the three kinds of consciousness classed as wholesome is completed.
